page.title: 07 SHARLSTON PIT
page.content: Sharlston is a coal mining village, with the pit at it's centre. The coal is to be found 1500 feet beneath the surface.The pit is about 600 years old and has gone through a lot of changes.In the past miners used pick and shovels.Tubs of coal would be pulled by pit ponies.In it's heyday 2500 men and 120 ponies worked there. Now there are about 1000 people working at the pit,using modern coal cutting machines and conveyor belts to bring it out.The pit has about 15 to 20 years of life left in it. The mining community are recovering from the effcts of a year long national strike,which was sparked off by pit closures nationwide regarding uneconomic pits.During the strike many of the miners ran up large debts,some even sold their homes.
